text: Can: Murky-brown with an off-white head; dried fruits, chocolate and coffee in the bitter-sweet nose; moderate to solid bitter-sweet flavour with a very mild acidity, medium bodied, pretty soft; lingering drier fruity (blueberries? really?) and coffeeish finish with a robust bitter tail and a delicate alcohol-burn in the aftertaste. Nice, nice...

660ml bottle. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is grassy hop nettle, light roast. The flavour is moderate bitter with a roasty, light liqourice fresh grassy hop bitter palate and a long bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Backlog z CBC, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer. Ciemne owoce, przyprawy, karmel. Do≈õƒá wodniste. Bardzo smaczne.

(can 0,33l from Brew Cavern (Nottingham))
Aroma: Raisins, alcohol, spicy, sweet.
Appearance: Black-ruby color. Rocky, huge, light brown head.
Taste: Medium sweet, spicy, raisins, light roasty, light bitter.
Palate: Medium body. Dry-roasty, light warm finish. 
Overall: Very nice porter. Seems stronger.

0,33l can from Damian Bottleshop, Bratislava, Pours cloudy dark brown liquid, huge frothy tan head, Aroma: chocolate, blueberry, spices, milk sweetness, noble wood, vanilla, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, medium sour, chocolate, red fruits, wood, cherry, roasty, Palate: medium body, soft carbonation, creamy to oily mouthfeel, long chocolate sour aftertaste, Overall: fine, enjoyed, bit too sour roasty, but in general, very good.

33cl can at home from FirmaBier. Nose is cocoa, dried fruits, roasted malt. Body is dark brown, head is very big, rocky, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, cocoa, light smoke, tobacco, old wood. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty medium bitter. Medium body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Easy dessert beer, simple but very tasty, great one.
Amazing brownish foam top. Hop and berries aroma. Well balanced and tasteful porter. Good pick :)
Bomber from beermerchants. Dark color. Medium beige brown head. Medium bitterness, low to medium sweetness. Aroma is roasted, cacao, orange, hops, spices.

Can from Firma Bier, BB Feb 17, large sample. Dark brown color, huge rocky head. Aroma of lots of hop, earthy, pine, coffee, dark malts. Like a black IPA. Medium hoppy bitterness, slight roast, some spicy coffee, bit caramel sweetness. Good beer.
A colablack beer, a head is huge and beige. Aroma has coffee, roastiness and unique blueberries. Taste has roastiness of coffee, blueberries. Medium bodied. Coffee with blueberries, simple.

33cl can. Dark brown pour with a tall tan head with good retention. The smell is very hop-forward, with background notes of chocolate and roasted malts. The taste follows the same notes, with grapefruit and pine resin up front followed by dark chocolate, a bit of coffee and roasted grains. Medium bodied, medium to high carbonation and a roasty bitter aftertaste.

33 cl can. BBE 02/2017.
Pours dark mahogany red color with a huge off-white fluffy head. Quite hoppy aroma, nutty notes, caramel sweetness and toasted malts, some subtle fruit notes too. Malty flavor with strong bitterness, caramel, some ripe fruit tones, hops and subtle berry notes, some nuts and toffee on the background. Carbonation is strong but doesn¬ít make this too watery, quite pleasant palate actually, very tasty too.
4425

Can from Favourite Beers, Cheltenham. Pours cloudy deep brown with a massive frothy cream head. Very lively. Quite a hoppy grapefruit aroma. The taste is hoppy with grapefruit over some nice coffee especially in the finish. Really good.
330ml can from Ales By Mail. Very dark brown, massive foamy head. Leafy hop aroma. Chocolate coffee flavour. Mild bitter coffee hop flavour. A bit watery. Hybrid between a porter and Black IPA.
Hoppy aroma over roasted malts. The taste is good, made nicer with the aroma.

Keg at The Moor Brewery Tap, Bristol. Very dark brown with cream head. This is a rich and full beer, darkly roasted malts, plummy fruity and very smooth. Pretty luscious and lasting. A very decent porter indeed.

Can @Bir&Fud Bottega (Rome). Pours deep brown with a medium cappuccino head. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, cheesecake, some light bad off-flavours, like fermented fruits, sewer. Flavour is definitely better, good roasted malts base with a vinous character, well balanced. Medium body, medium carbonation. Ok.

Can, pours dark with a large foamy tan head. Aromas is dark malts, chocolate, caramel, with lots of citrus hops. Body is medium full, texture is creamy, finish is balanced and light bitter. Excellent, although one of the cans I had gushed for no apparent reason.

Shared bottle at RB/HD at Sigmund¬¥s at Tau 15.03.16. Very dark brown. Dense and persistent brown head and lacing. Aroma of black IPA, blackcurrants, bilberries and citrus. Similar taste. Complex while retaining good drinkability.

Delt 0,66 l flaske p√• RBHD-treff p√• Tau, mars 2016. Klar granatfarget kropp med en lysebrun film. Lukten er en fin og innbydende blanding av tropiske frukter og milde r√∏stede toner. Smaken bekrefter luktinntrykket med en aromatisk bitterhet sammen med milde r√∏stede toner. Fin fylde med et snev av varme. Ikke en typisk porter, mer en Black APA.

Flaske p√• RBHD-treff hos Sigmund, mars-16: brunsvart med flott beige skum som varer. B√¶raktig humlearoma med stor fylde og sjarme. Raffinert smak, passe bitter og med stoor drikkbarhet! Lett i kroppen for sitt vitamininnhold, s√• det bare h√∏yner drikkbarheten. Stilmessig er panelet er enige om at denne er en black ipa, og ikke en porter. Det lekre streifet av bl√•b√¶r gj√∏r kanskje at den kvalifiserer til en av fem om dagen?

Shared 660 ml bottle at local tasting, ABV is 6%. Dark brown colour, nearly black. Moderate beige head. Aroma of roast malts, chocolate, some piney hops, hints of wine. Dry flavour, roast malts and coffee, fairly distinct hops.

Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours clear dark ruby with a small creamy tanned head. Aroma is hoppy, resiny dark with some clean dark malts. Smooth creamy mouthfeel. Taste is light sweet initially with a decent liquorice and berries addition, very good mouthfeel, and leaves my mouth covered with delicious liquorice. Nice beer all over.
Tap at The Rake, 2nd March 16. Pours black, aroma is chocolate, coffee, smooth, nice. Taste is smooth, silky, chocolate, mocha, slight coffee, ice cream. Really nice

On tap @ The Rake, London - UK. Color: deep dark black beer with brown reflection. No carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt and chocolate notes. Taste: medium body with roasted malt, chocolate notes and mocha finish. Good attenuation and easy drinkable. Hoppy finish. Aftertaste: roasted malt and chocolate with wet bitterness and hoppy with grassy notes.

660ml bottle. Opaque, darkest brown colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Chocolately, dark malty aroma, spicy, herbal hoppy overtones, hints of (blue-)berry shrubs, a touch of blueberry and black currant. Taste is slightly sweet, chocolately dark malty, refreshing fruity hoppy overtones, notes of blueberry, hints of black currant, herbal spicy overtones of corresponding shrubs, some hop bitterness. Excellent juxtaposition of partly matching and partly antagonistic malt and hop flavours arrange for a refreshing, agile ensemble operating mentally inspiring till the last drop.
Delicate light taste, a little sweet. Overally I found this one pretty boring.

Bottle 660ml. @ [ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2015 (TEODRBSG15) ] - fonefan & Brugmansia House, Denmark. [ As Moor B-Moor ].Clear dark brown color with a average to large, frothy - creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, dark malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, pine, tropical fruit. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, pine, tropical fruit, hop bitter, roasted - chocolate. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150829]

Draft sample at the Great British Weekend New Edition 2015 Belgrade Serbia.11.09.2015.Pour it dark color with small black head.Aroma of roasted malt.Taste of sweet milky chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruits, some spices.Good balanced.

660ml . In a Brewdog snifter. (Phone rake ). Floral hops and roasted malt boxing match in the nose . Coffee , dark chocolate , grapefruit notes : Khaki head above dark brown liquid . This stuff has a more Black IPA texture than a textbook Porter . Very hop aromatic , rich ,juicy , and bitter interacting with rich roast , coffee , burnt chocolate. Quite fruity through out - lychee in there under roast . A pretty nice hoppy Porter .üçª

660ml bottle from Ales by Mail
BBE 31 May 2016 - Pours dark brown, almost black with a thick foamy head. Aroma of roasty malts, licorice, hints of hops, blueberries and coffee. Taste is smooth, roasty, hoppy and malty with some hops, licorice and blueberries. Finish is crisp, hoppy, roasty and malty with some coffee and blueberries. Tasty and balanced, quite unique porter.

660 ml bottle. Pours a pitch black colour with a creamy beige head. Looks delicious. Aroma of heavy roastiness, fresh citrusy hoppiness, a bit of orange pith and chocolate. Rich flavour of strong citrusy bitterness, pine, dark chocolate, licorice root and a bit of dark berry tartness. Incredibly rich mouthfeel. Lingering bitter, fruity, slightly tart finish. Very fresh and tasty. Clearly one of the best porters I¬íve ever had, if not the best. You can still make great beers without gimmicky barrel aging. Moor rules.
Bottle.Black with a small head. Subtle chocolate and citrus flavours blend together with bitterness in the background. All I thought it would be and more( sorry about the pun )

(keg) murky brown colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of hazelnuts and wodka, with lots of sugar icing, some milk chocolate and treebark. flavour is mostly hazelnuts and roasted malts, with some more sugar icing, yeast and a touch of grass in the finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle at Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2015, Ulfborg. Pours dark brown with a medium tan head. Aroma of citrus, pine, overripe dark fruit, dark chocolate and roast. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to light heavy bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Gravicask (PBF2015, Friday)
Is this the right beer? This is Illusion, I¬ím sure. Huge BIPA aroma. Beautiful BIPA taste. No alcohol at all, so I can easily believe it¬ís 4.5%, but 6% seems unlikely. Yum - I love Illusion, and that¬ís what this is, according to my senses.

Bottle, 12C. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of mocha, toast, berries, new leather. Silky, lowish carbonation. Almost milky. Sweet mocha and Indian sweets, blackcurrants, some citrus that¬ís a little Lemon Pledge. The roasted notes are not that strong but seem well defined. Fruity hops (some citrus, I get more blackcurrant than blueberry), fairly high bitterness. Quite interesting - quite sweet but very clean and not heavy at all; hops contribute berries and then take over at the finish. I liked this a lot.

On tap at Holy Grale. Pours a dark brown with a light beige head that leaves a fair amount of lacing. Aroma of mixed berries, dark fruits, hops, roasty malts. Taste is citrusy hops, blueberries, roasted malts, dark fruits, and a bit of chocolate. Medium bodied, slick texture, moderate carbonation. Tasty, but different for a porter in that the chocolate and malt take a bit of a backseat to the hops and blueberry. Definitely tastes more like a black IPA than a porter.
Tried at the Peterborough beer festival. Deep dark brown colour with an off white head. Roasted malt and fruit aroma and taste. Nice.

Sampled at 8th Danish Ratebeer Gathering, Ulfborg 2015, day 2. Dark brown color with a red glare coming through, medium sized beige head. Smell and taste malts, some hops, nicely bitter coming from both the malts and the hops. Medium body and carbonation. Quite nice,

Bottle, 6%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, berries?, hop and a grapefruit. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel, medium sweet, hop, berries?, little grapefruit, pine and bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, berries, fruits and hops.

Sampled @ Danish Summer Gathering 2015

Tr√ºbe dunkel orangebraune Farbe. Geruch sehr hopfig, bitter, leicht r√∂stmalzig, Karamell. Geschmack r√∂stmalzig, Karamell, sehr hopfig, leicht harzig, gut!
Trockener, vollmundig malziger Antrunk. Rund trocken, die Malzigkeit wird durch Hopfennoten erg√§nzt. Nett. 13/11/10/11/9/11

At Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2015 in Ulfborg. Day 2. 
Deep brown beer with a nice lasting beige head. Hoppy citrus aroma, licorice, chocolate, cocoa, leather, earthy notes. Roasted hoppy flavor, grapes, citrus, chocolate, pine apples, some earthy notes and licorice. Probably a black IPA rather than a porter, but a really nice beer.

Bottle Creamy lightbrown good fully lasting head. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter wonderfull flavor. Long moderate bitter finish. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Wonderfull.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry rather bitter finish. More black IPA than porter. 290815

Bottle. Black beer with a strong frothy brown head. The aroma is nicely bitter, and the flavour is heavily bitter and roasted with some malty and yeastiness. Overall a nice bitter porter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Dark brownish black with light tan head. Aromas of rye spice, cocoa. Tastes of rye spice, roast, toasty notes, light chocolate. Medium body with a dry finish.
Bottle @ Odense Summer Gathering, 2015. Pours nearly black with a small white head. Rich malty, caramel and grains. Nutty. Roast. A bit of smoke. Robust. Smooth and soft.

Ratebeer Odense Summer Gathering 2015. Near black with a lasting off-white head. Malty aroma with dried fruit, dark berries and a touch of bacon. Sweetish roast malt flavour with fruity notes, chocolate and nuts..
Odense ratebeer summer gathering 2015. Pours dark red with a white head. Aroma of nuts, sligh roast, dark fruit. Taste of dried fruits, nuts, hops, slight roast.

Cask at the Magpie, near black with a coarse off-white head and aromas of berry leaves, coffee, cocoa. Roasty dry-sweet and sharp earthily bitter body, Lightly creamy and fruity texture, a little red fruit emerging in the finish alongside roasty malt and an astringent bittersweetness. Complex and fascinating.

Cask at Pie & Ale, Manchester. Black with a hint of red. Dense creamy head, lacing. A nice chocolatey, cocoa, light coffee and fruity sweetness. Not exactly replicating blueberry but it does seem fairly similar. Some bitterness present too. Decent porter.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with a big creamy light tan head, aroma has light pine and chocolate, taste has chocolate some roast, some vibrant hop action, citrus, bitter chocolate, pleasant stuff.

On tap at Moor Brewery Tap, Bristol, Saturday 30th May 2015 in company of Lynn and Barry  Very dark in appearance with a beige head, hoppy and malty from the off, but also a good fruit bite with hedgerow berries on the nose and in the mouth and a bit of demerara sugar and malt. Quite a good slightly bitter Porter as you might expect from Moor, but it¬ís lovely. The end is dry. A7 A3 T8 P4 Ov15 3.7
Pours dark brown, little head. Aromas of berry fruit and dark chocolate. Taste is quite bitter,and very roasty . Medium body, creamy texture, fruity finish. Nice.

Bottle shared at the Cad¬ís 10th Anniversary Tasting - CBC Clerkenwell, London. Picked up at Bottle Shop Bermondsey. Pours clear brown with a frothy tan head. The nose holds toasted brown bread, light dry chocolate and earth. Medium sweet flavor with some sugary brown bread, toasty pine, mellow cocoa. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Moderate sweetness to finish, more dry chocolate, some earthy hops, citrus fruits. Solid effort as usual from Moor.

Bottle at the Cads 10th Anniversary bash, thanks to LKS, 29/03/15. 
Rich chestnut brown topped with a decent beige covering.
Nose is toffee, cocoa powder, red berry fruit, sweet tunes, nutty tinge.
Taste comprises light charr, toffee, blueberry, spice, chocolate.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a light roasted cloak.
Decent porter.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at Brewdog Shepherd¬ís Bush, London. A black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty, berry fruit aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, berry fruit. A very nice porter from Moor.

Keg at the Brewdog Shepard¬ís Bush. Opaque black coloured pour with a lasting creamy light tan head. Very attractive. Aroma is lovely fresh lemon hop, cascade, light nutty roast. Really fresh on the nose. Flavour is composed of fresh lemon floral hop, lemony zip, light milk choc,mellow roast and dry finish. Very clean ferment. Palate is medium light, moderate carbonation. Verges on a black IPA / hoppy porter. Extremely drinkable.

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This is an extremely dark brown beer with ruby red highlights and a large white rocky head of foam. It has a rich dark chocolate and roasted coffee flavour, blueberry and red berry notes followed by oak, pine and more bitter chocolate on the smooth finish. Awesome!

Draft @ BrewDog Shepherd¬ís Bush, Shepherd¬ís Bush W12. Pours an almost black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty caramle aroma with weak hints of blueberry. Roasted malty caramel and licorice flavor with hints of blueberry. Has a roasted malty caramel and blueberry finish.

Piana obfita, kremowa, drobna, ale do≈õƒá szybko opada do ko≈ºuszka oblepiajƒÖc przy tym piƒôknie snifter. Barwa ciemny brƒÖz wymieszany z niemal≈ºe czarnƒÖ wi≈õniƒÖ. W aromacie zdecydowanie na pierwszym planie zio≈Çowo-chmielowe nuty, ≈ºywica, palono≈õƒá, likier i czekolada. Pachnie intensywnie, po ameryka≈Ñsku, wrƒôcz jak Black IPA z dodatkiem kakao. ≈öwietnie! W smaku natomiast piwo jest p√≥≈Çs≈Çodkie i p√≥≈Çpe≈Çne w odczuciu, porterowa palono≈õƒá, gorzka czekolada i likier kawowy kontrowane potƒô≈ºnie iglakowo-zio≈Çowym chmielem ze ≈õredniƒÖ goryczkƒÖ, fantastycznie balansujƒÖcƒÖ "porterowo≈õƒá" trunku. Nasycenie do≈õƒá niskie, aczkolwiek lekko szczypiƒÖce, alkohol perfekcyjnie ukryty. W afterteasie chmiel i pra≈ºone ziarno, delikatna kwaskowo≈õƒá i skojarzenie z bor√≥wkƒÖ ameryka≈ÑskƒÖ "na zasadzie percepcji". 
Bardzo dobre piwo. Powiedzia≈Çbym, ≈ºe jest to Black IPA uwarzona na bazie Porteru Amoor, w kt√≥rym zwiƒôkszono ekstrakt, zawarto≈õƒá alkoholu i konkretnie "po ameryka≈Ñsku" nachmielono na aromat i goryczkƒô. Co by nie m√≥wiƒá - wysz≈Ço przepysznie i odlotowo, a przy tym pijalnie!

keg at the brewerymosaic front and centre as a jammy blueberry note, medium body and carbonation, fruit filled with slight toasty chocolate in finish. could have drunk this all day if we¬íd had some spare time!

Bottle share at CBC Clerkenwell, thanks to Leighton! BB Dec 2015, 6%. Black, big foamy tan head. Aroma is smoke, toffee. Body is medium, slightly foamy, low carbonation. Taste is toffee, twiggy, biscuity malts, ashy with a light bitterness in the finish. Good porter.  Assuming from their advertising that they used Bramling Cross, this didn¬ít come across massively.  Hoping for a C-Moor Imperial porter, but they must have already thought of this...

Aroma: coffee, light toasted malts, dark berries, some cocoa. Appearance: black, medium, frothy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: subtle bitters continue, some coffee, fruity, blueberry cheesecake they say and I think I can taste it, getting quite bitter and dry in the long finish. Overall: absolutely stunning Porter, amazing range of flavors in aroma and palate. Pint at the brewery, Bristol.

Keg at BD Sheps B. It pours deep brown with a small tan. The nose is roasty, dark fruits, bitter-sweet, cocoa, rocky road, blueberry and toasty brown sugar. The taste is bitter, rich roast, cocoa, dark fruits, toasty brown sugar, berry, light spice and earth with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Good body and depth. Really tasty stuff. Great.

66cl Bottle shared at The Bottle Shop. Black colour, light-beige head. Aroma of blueberries, roasted malts, nicely hopped as well. Flavour is light sweet, fruity, blueberries, roasted malts, earthy, nicely bitter, fruity and hoppy finish. Light to medium bodied. Nice.
Bottle shared with Peter and Rob. Black beer. Some fruit some earthynesd hont of blackberry. Lovely good mouthfeel. Lovely fruit skin brown malt flavour.
Muscat grapes aroma. White lacing. Dark cacoa. Dark colour which reds out. Some nice chocolate notes; cacoa; some hey and wheat and blackcurrants. A classic porter. Probably a lot of Bramling Cross.

18th February 2015Chelmsford Winter Beer Festival in KEGS. Cask. Almost opaque dark brown beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and semi dry, mild fine carbonation. Tangy brown malts. Little tangy dried fruits. Mild spice. Light dry finish. Mellow bitter linger. Nit bad.

Keg at the Bottle Shop tap takeover, London. It pours a rich dark brown color with tan head. Aroma is rich espresso and dark chocolate with light wood and citrus. Taste is medium bitter and quite dry with notes of cocoa nibs, espresso, vanilla, wood and earth. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very tasty

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Though I tried this beer a couple of days ago I remember that it was of impeccapble appearance with great blueberry/forest fruits and chocolate aroma. The taste was medium sweet with a hint of accidity, based mostly on chocolate, roasted notes and blueberry. The bitterness was short, earthly. Smooth beer that made me think of it as a lower-bitterness variation of Black IPA rather than a porter but it didn¬ít matter after all. Great beer for sure.
Dark brown colour with great, white head. Sweet aroma with notes of ash and coffee. Taste is medium sweet with, roasted, sour, ash notes. With also dark chocolate, coffee and hint of hop.

Tap. Rutland Arms, Sheffield. Hazy, dark brown. Big, rocky, lasting, beige head. Dried fruits. Light coffee. Woody roast. Blackcurrant. Some green hop. Taste is sweet, turning roasty dry. Lovely, smooth, rich, massaging palate. Finishes light sweet, light bitter, with a roasty, dry close. Delightful!
Fruity hops. Slightly yeasty smell. Blueberries. The beer is thick and sweet. Great level of bitterness. Woody complexity going. The aftertaste is biscuity.

Drank it from the keg at Sisten Irish Pub , Italy , great porter beer , good aroma with chocolate and toasty notes . Appearance is just awesome , pours a spectacular thick foam , a real eye candy ! B-moor tastes very good, full bodied and average carbonation , bitter finish that leaves a long aftertaste ! great beer !
bottle scura buona schiuma media persistenza buon profumo sotto bosco luppolato cioccolato buona secchezza buona beva discreto amaro

W aromacie bardzo dobre po≈ÇƒÖczenie chmielowej ≈õwie≈ºo≈õci i czekolady, nieco deserowej, nieco mlecznej, nuty zio≈Çowe, bardzo dobra kompozycja. W smaku wytrawne, zbo≈ºowo - czekoladowe z lekkƒÖ palono≈õciƒÖ, nieco mleczne w odczuciu, goryczka niewielka, niewiele pe≈Çni, finisz zio≈Çowy, choƒá bez zalegajƒÖcej goryczki. W smaku definitywnie porter, mimo, ≈ºe w aromacie jak BIPA. Ciekawe, smaczne piwo.

Stappi la bottiglia e baamm...attacco al naso di aromi misti di frutta rossa e caff√®!! Al bicchiere sembra una tipica Porter...in bocca uno spettacolo di sapori con un finale di cacao in polvere che sale al naso!! Moor = More!!! Stupito e ottima bevuta!
Cask at the Stockbridge tap... Deep brown.. Thin tan head... Soft sweet roast... Bih berries.. Juicy fruits roast... Deep berries.. Big roast
Cask at Stockbridge tap. Pours black, nose is chocolate, fruity, light roast, taste is sweet, chocolate, blueberry, fruity.

On cask at the Stockbridge Tap. 
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - jammy fruit, hint of toffee or chocolate in the background. 
Taste - dark fruit confirmed. It could as easily be plum as blueberry. It integrates beautifully and slightly dominates the dark malt notes. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy and taut texture. The finish is elegant and balanced. Great. 
Overall - a lovely elegant beer.
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours dark brown, thin tan head. Aromas of berry fruit, light chocolate. Taste is hop bitter, roasty too. Medium body, creamy texture, fruity finish. Nice.

Bottle from Brewer¬ís Droop, Bristol. Near black, with a big, tan, head. Sweetish beery fruits, some plain chocolate, toasty malts and a hoppy edge, before a crisp, dryish finish. An excellent beer with which to end 2014.

From brewers droop, Bristol
660ml bottle BBE:31 Dec 2015
Blood alc: 0mg/100ml

Pours black with a big thick beige head which smells, ok, I?ll go with cheesecake and taste like delicious fruity hops. The beer itself has a slightly yeasty smell but this one is very young. It?s very berry like,I think the comparison to blueberries is genuine. The beer is very thick and pretty sweet, a great level of bitterness and there?s some woody complexity going on alongside the berry. The delayed aftertaste is biscuity.This is a pretty excellent beer which doors a great job of doing what, in my mind, moor do, which is to bridge the gap between ?traditional? brewing and ?craft? beer. What I mean is that moor are a good ?gateway? brewery for those not yet fully introduced to many modern styles but still enjoyable for those who are.
=84%
